body_html:
Replacing the existing numpy with numpy‑1.14.5+mkl‑cp36‑cp36m‑win_amd64.whl from https://www.lfd.uci.edu/~gohlke/pythonlibs/#numpy resolved the issue for me (but not before wasting hours in try-this-and-that).
It would've been nice if this issue was mentioned on the PyTorch installation page.
body_text:
Replacing the existing numpy with numpy‑1.14.5+mkl‑cp36‑cp36m‑win_amd64.whl from https://www.lfd.uci.edu/~gohlke/pythonlibs/#numpy resolved the issue for me (but not before wasting hours in try-this-and-that).
It would've been nice if this issue was mentioned on the PyTorch installation page.
body:
Replacing the existing numpy with **numpy‑1.14.5+mkl‑cp36‑cp36m‑win_amd64.whl** from [https://www.lfd.uci.edu/~gohlke/pythonlibs/#numpy](https://www.lfd.uci.edu/~gohlke/pythonlibs/#numpy) resolved the issue for me (but not before wasting hours in try-this-and-that). 
It would've been nice if this issue was mentioned on the PyTorch installation page.
